definition: a long way in front/to lead by a wide margin
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc

sentences.english: The US is far ahead," he said.
sentences.chinese: 美国已经在方面遥遥领先了，”他说。

sentences.english: As an individual country, America still leads the world by some distance.
sentences.chinese: 按单国来论，美国在世界上仍然遥遥领先。

sentences.english: You’ll be far far ahead before they realize what to do.
sentences.chinese: 你已经在他们意识到如何做之前遥遥领先。

sentences.english: Our language is the best by a mile.
sentences.chinese: 我们的语言遥遥领先，顶顶棒。

sentences.english: The technology and telecommunications in Shenzhen are cutting edge!
sentences.chinese: 深圳的科技和电讯业遥遥领先。

sentences.english: As Barack Obama appears to pull ahead, what options remain for John McCain?
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马遥遥领先，麦凯恩无力回天？

sentences.english: China is leading the steel industry in the world because of its huge quantity of production.
sentences.chinese: 中国的钢铁行业即使放眼世界是在数量上遥遥领先的。

sentences.english: Japan has a good lead over other car-producing countries.
sentences.chinese: 日本遥遥领先其它汽车生产国。

sentences.english: China's reserves are by far the largest in the world.
sentences.chinese: 中国的外汇储备量全球第一遥遥领先。

sentences.english: The team has pull well ahead of the rest in the championship.
sentences.chinese: 这个队在锦标赛中遥遥领先于其他各队。

sentences.english: Those who had learned the letters by handwriting came out best in all tests.
sentences.chinese: 在所有测试中，那些用手写学会字母的人遥遥领先。

sentences.english: That white horse is running away from other horses in the horse-race.
sentences.chinese: 那匹白马在赛马中遥遥领先于其他马。

definition: to take the lead in a race/to set the pace

to come first in triennial palace examinations (idiom, refers to the carved stone turtle head in front of the imperial palace, next to which the most successful candidate in the imperial examinations was entitled to stand)/to be the champion/to be the very best in any field
lit. late-comer lives above (idiom); the up-and-coming youngster outstrips the older generation/the pupil surpasses the master
to stand above/to occupy an important position/to rank (among the top few)
